HDG.WM.content: turn away from nothing into beings: hasten into public superficies of our existence > what testifies (zeugt) to manifestation (Offenbarkeit) of nothing in our existence more than negation? > “not (das Nicht)” more original [?] than negation, negating only one way of nihilating (one way of comporting grounded beforehand in in nihilation of nothing) [annihilation is another way?] > “not” becomes manifest only when nihilation of nothing disengaged from concealment: idea of “logic” disintegrates in turbulence of more originary questioning [has this been proven?]
HDG.WM.linkedContent: turn away from nothing into beings: hasten into public superficies of our existence > what testifies (zeugt) to manifestation (Offenbarkeit) of nothing in our existence more than negation? > “not (das Nicht)” more original [?] than negation, negating only one way of nihilating (one way of comporting grounded beforehand in in nihilation of nothing) [annihilation is another way?] > “not” becomes manifest only when nihilation of nothing disengaged from concealment: idea of “logic” disintegrates in turbulence of more originary questioning [has this been proven?]

HDG.QB.content: to connect “work” & “pain”: think fundamental trait of Hegel’s metaphysics: “absolute negativity” as “infinite force” of actuality, i.e., of the “existing concept” > work & pain manifest their innermost metaphysical relatedness in same (not identical) belonging to negation of negation
HDG.QB.linkedContent: to connect “work” & “pain”: think fundamental trait of Hegel’s metaphysics: “absolute negativity” as “infinite force” of actuality, i.e., of the “existing concept” > work & pain manifest their innermost metaphysical relatedness in same (not identical) belonging to negation of negation

HDG.FS.content: kosmos, not the largest in which all finds their space, not space [world? via Diels] but way of being: Zier (adornment): radiance/gleam/Zeus > kosmeō: bring into an order > “world,” immediately calls to mind idea of great Whole, lead to Kantian “cosmology,” then space expeditions (cosmonauts)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: kosmos, not the largest in which all finds their space, not space [world? via Diels] but way of being: Zier (adornment): radiance/gleam/Zeus > kosmeō: bring into an order > “world,” immediately calls to mind idea of great Whole, lead to Kantian “cosmology,” then space expeditions (cosmonauts)

HDG.FS.content: acc. Heidegger, for Hegel, bad infinite = endless character of finite, ad infinitum; true infinite, in-finite, sublation of finite, where finite is abandoned (das Endliche verlassen wird) = power of conjoining itself
HDG.FS.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, for Hegel, bad infinite = endless character of finite, ad infinitum; true infinite, in-finite, sublation of finite, where finite is abandoned (das Endliche verlassen wird) = power of conjoining itself

HDG.FS.content: for Kant, ground of everything, only idea (opposed to intuition/concept) of speculative reason, ungrounded, abyssal > Kant witnessed with horror what began to take place w/ Fichte: Fichte & Hegel look for ground where for Kant there’s only abyss
HDG.FS.linkedContent: for Kant, ground of everything, only idea (opposed to intuition/concept) of speculative reason, ungrounded, abyssal > Kant witnessed with horror what began to take place w/ Fichte: Fichte & Hegel look for ground where for Kant there’s only abyss

HDG.FS.content: “reflection,” Latin re-flexere, turning-back upon itself (zurückzuwenden), towards the ego > in Descartes, ego, as cogitans, appears as cogitatum, object > in Kant’s language: “it must be possible for the I think to accompany all my representations” > transcendental apperception re: finite essence of man > Hegel absolutizes finite understanding, brings power of conjoining to absolute power: “what is finite w/ man becomes the infinite Absolute” > infinite as sublation of finite
HDG.FS.linkedContent: “reflection,” Latin re-flexere, turning-back upon itself (zurückzuwenden), towards the ego > in Descartes, ego, as cogitans, appears as cogitatum, object > in Kant’s language: “it must be possible for the I think to accompany all my representations” > transcendental apperception re: finite essence of man > Hegel absolutizes finite understanding, brings power of conjoining to absolute power: “what is finite w/ man becomes the infinite Absolute” > infinite as sublation of finite

HDG.FS.content: Plato names eidōlon as mē on (“un-being”), distinguishes from ouk on, sheer non-being [cf. pp. 39, 42] > eidōlon also distinguished from eidos, that which shows itself, what one sees > but one can’t reach eidos w/out eidōlon, table obscured by wood of which it’s made > Aristotle brings Ideas back to earth, eidos becomes morphē of a tode ti in motion/rest: kinēsis (and for Aristotle all moves) defined as energeai (entelecheia), thus energeia highest determination of being
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Plato names eidōlon as mē on (“un-being”), distinguishes from ouk on, sheer non-being [cf. pp. 39, 42] > eidōlon also distinguished from eidos, that which shows itself, what one sees > but one can’t reach eidos w/out eidōlon, table obscured by wood of which it’s made > Aristotle brings Ideas back to earth, eidos becomes morphē of a tode ti in motion/rest: kinēsis (and for Aristotle all moves) defined as energeai (entelecheia), thus energeia highest determination of being

HDG.FS.content: Hegel: “Reason constructs itself in its emanation as an identity that is conditioned by this very duplicate [Reason’s appearance]” > acc. Heidegger, understand Hegel by explicating “infinite world-intuition” > intuition—individual; concept—general
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Hegel: “Reason constructs itself in its emanation as an identity that is conditioned by this very duplicate [Reason’s appearance]” > acc. Heidegger, understand Hegel by explicating “infinite world-intuition” > intuition—individual; concept—general

HDG.FS.content: how does dialectical movement avoid falling back into domination of finite, in guise of bad infinite? > answer circularity runs into this difficulty w/out resolving it [beyond hermeneutic circle?]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: how does dialectical movement avoid falling back into domination of finite, in guise of bad infinite? > answer circularity runs into this difficulty w/out resolving it [beyond hermeneutic circle?]

HDG.FS.content: how does Platonic idea (eidos) correspond to what Greeks named presence, ousia, the most extreme excess? for Plato, to change, to alter oneself (sich ändern): abwesen (to absence)—idea as pure presence, never absencing, self-maintaining-making-present, presencing presence (anwesende Anwesenheit) as what’s there in excess, ontos on (Nietzsche had strong sense of this, Twilight of…)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: how does Platonic idea (eidos) correspond to what Greeks named presence, ousia, the most extreme excess? for Plato, to change, to alter oneself (sich ändern): abwesen (to absence)—idea as pure presence, never absencing, self-maintaining-making-present, presencing presence (anwesende Anwesenheit) as what’s there in excess, ontos on (Nietzsche had strong sense of this, Twilight of…)

HDG.FS.content: Husserlian idea of “surplus (Überschusses)”: the “is” through which I observe object/substance is a “surplus” re: sensuous affections > categorial just as given as sensuous, thus CATEGORIAL INTUITION > Husserl teaches CI by way of analogy (a measure for correspondence): categorial corresponds to sense data (which is the measure of the analogy)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Husserlian idea of “surplus (Überschusses)”: the “is” through which I observe object/substance is a “surplus” re: sensuous affections > categorial just as given as sensuous, thus CATEGORIAL INTUITION > Husserl teaches CI by way of analogy (a measure for correspondence): categorial corresponds to sense data (which is the measure of the analogy)

HDG.MA.content: can a new ground/foundation be granted gain to man? new authochthony? > perhaps answer is near, near is always longest/hardest for humans > meditative thinking demands we not cling one-sidedly to a single idea: engage ourselves w/ what, at 1st sight, doesn’t go together at all [not a monomaniacal thought]
HDG.MA.linkedContent: can a new ground/foundation be granted gain to man? new authochthony? > perhaps answer is near, near is always longest/hardest for humans > meditative thinking demands we not cling one-sidedly to a single idea: engage ourselves w/ what, at 1st sight, doesn’t go together at all [not a monomaniacal thought]

HDG.LP.content: Dieses Scheiden [from the old Geschlecht] ist verborgen geschicklich ent-schieden zum Abschied, der aus der Abgeschiedenheit zugerufen wird [the call of apartness] > the wandering of apartness [in night]: “unendliche Qual (infinite torment),” i.e. perfect pain, pain come to its fullness > the Einfalt of the converseness that prevails in pain comes to pure play (reine Spiel) only by wandering through ghostly night & parting from the unghostly night [ontic/ontological]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: Dieses Scheiden [from the old Geschlecht] ist verborgen geschicklich ent-schieden zum Abschied, der aus der Abgeschiedenheit zugerufen wird [the call of apartness] > the wandering of apartness [in night]: “unendliche Qual (infinite torment),” i.e. perfect pain, pain come to its fullness > the Einfalt of the converseness that prevails in pain comes to pure play (reine Spiel) only by wandering through ghostly night & parting from the unghostly night [ontic/ontological]

HDG.EC.content: doesn’t this thought that Being is malicious (bösartig) in the Ground of its essence (im Grunde seines Wesens) place an awful demand (arge Zumutung) on human thinking? > even more when one should not regard the idea that evil dwells in essence of Being as pessimistic > that thinking should be easy is a thought from spirit of devastation [spirit of revenge?]
HDG.EC.linkedContent: doesn’t this thought that Being is malicious (bösartig) in the Ground of its essence (im Grunde seines Wesens) place an awful demand (arge Zumutung) on human thinking? > even more when one should not regard the idea that evil dwells in essence of Being as pessimistic > that thinking should be easy is a thought from spirit of devastation [spirit of revenge?]

HDG.OHF.content: categories are haphazardly employed (from disparate sources) to characterize the basis (Boden) from out of which classifying begins to run its course (seinen Gang nimmt) > “that the Ausgangsverhalten is unworried (Unbekümmertheit) [since worry is there in opening to phenomenological hermeneutics] about its own concrete and precise clarification when the classifying and filing away is being done” “is only a symptom of the fact that its objects are ‘only’ material for a typology and system of classification” > idea of knowledge pursued (angestrebte) here, already sketched out in advance (schon vorgezeichnet) [goes on to describe static system, structuralism even]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: categories are haphazardly employed (from disparate sources) to characterize the basis (Boden) from out of which classifying begins to run its course (seinen Gang nimmt) > “that the Ausgangsverhalten is unworried (Unbekümmertheit) [since worry is there in opening to phenomenological hermeneutics] about its own concrete and precise clarification when the classifying and filing away is being done” “is only a symptom of the fact that its objects are ‘only’ material for a typology and system of classification” > idea of knowledge pursued (angestrebte) here, already sketched out in advance (schon vorgezeichnet) [goes on to describe static system, structuralism even]

HDG.OHF.content: (formal indication) forehaving of Dasein = being-there of Dasein (factical life) is being in a world > the success of such a demonstration (Ausweisung) doesn’t say anything primordial about forehaving, is only a phenomenon of another forehaving lying further back (already at work in our descriptions) [infinite regress of forehaving, no arrival?] [but Heidegger stresses this being in a world only a formal indication, we must follow its indefiniteness to the right path of looking (rechte Blickbahn), by way of intuition?]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: (formal indication) forehaving of Dasein = being-there of Dasein (factical life) is being in a world > the success of such a demonstration (Ausweisung) doesn’t say anything primordial about forehaving, is only a phenomenon of another forehaving lying further back (already at work in our descriptions) [infinite regress of forehaving, no arrival?] [but Heidegger stresses this being in a world only a formal indication, we must follow its indefiniteness to the right path of looking (rechte Blickbahn), by way of intuition?]
